Hi everyone on Ballyalley. =C2=A0
I have an Astrocade from years ago that h=
as a missing wall-wart. =C2=A0All I have is the wire coming out of the mach=
ine with nothing on the end. =C2=A0I'm fairly capable with electronics, but=
 I don't yet want to desolder components inside the machine and give it the=
 necessary DC voltages. =C2=A0Option 1 is to obtain a used wall-wart. =C2=
=A0Does anyone have one they are willing to sell? =C2=A0These are fairly ol=
d, and aren't like most other wall-warts. =C2=A0They, as you know, put out =
AC at two different voltage. =C2=A0Any help or suggestions would be appreci=
ated.
TYIA.

Sent from Yahoo Mail on Android 
 
  On Fri, Dec 30, 2016 at 1=
:36 AM, David Dibbern daviddibbern@... [ballyalley]<ballyalley@yahoog=
roups.com> wrote:   =C2=A0   

What is the address for "the show"

"Hey Now=
..."
On Dec 29, 2016, at 8:13 PM, Adam Trionfo ballyalley@... [ball=
yalley] <ballyalley@yahoogroups.com> wrote:


 =C2=A0  



I first began li=
stening to podcasts about a year and a half ago.=C2=A0 Chris, my former co-=
host, suggested The 2600 Game by Game Podcast.=C2=A0 I've still not caught =
up on all those episodes, but I'm getting close.=C2=A0 One of my favorite p=
arts of any podcast, especially Ferg's podcast, are the Christmas/holiday m=
emories that people share.=C2=A0 I've heard all sorts of great Atari holida=
y-related stories, but for some reason Ferg has been suppressing all the st=
ories when people "boo" the Atari and are gung ho for the Bally.=C2=A0 It t=
ell ya-- it's a conspiracy.=C2=A0 (Okay, it might be all in my head!)

I'm =
sure that there must be some Bally Arcade/Astrocade stories out there.=C2=
=A0 If you're one of those few people who got a Bally Arcade under the Chri=
stmas tree on Christmas Day, then I'd love to hear your story.=C2=A0 Maybe =
the Bally was your only system.=C2=A0 Or, perhaps you already had an Atari =
and you pitted the two systems against each other.=C2=A0 Maybe you got a Ba=
lly Arcade very early (in January 1978) before the Atari VCS was king of Am=
erica's living rooms.=C2=A0 Or, maybe you got it as a gift while it was on =
clearance in 1984 for $25.=C2=A0 Do you have a sad tale to tell that involv=
es asking for an Astrocade, but you got an Atari instead?=C2=A0 Were you we=
re up all night crying about what might have been?=C2=A0 Possibly you have =
a four-player tale of playing 99 rounds of Checkmate against your parents a=
nd little sister on Christmas morning.

If your tale is holiday related (Ch=
ristmas, Hanukkah, or whatever you celebrate), then I'd love to hear it!=C2=
=A0 Please write in (email the show) and tell us all about it.=C2=A0 If you=
're one of those awesome folks who likes to record audio feedback, then tha=
t's welcome too.

The next episode of the Astrocast will feature this holid=
ay feedback in the December (okay, more like mid-January) episode.

I can't=
 wait to hear your tales!

Adam




  
    

------=_Part_4217403_775756552.1483144787580

<p></p>
<div>I first began listening to podcasts about a =
year and a half ago.  Chris, my former co-host, suggested The 2600 Gam=
e by Game Podcast.  I've still not caught up on all those episodes, bu=
t I'm getting close.  One of my favorite parts of any podcast, especia=
lly
 Ferg's podcast, are the Christmas/holiday memories that people share.&=
nbsp; I've heard all sorts of great Atari holiday-related stories, but for =
some reason Ferg has been suppressing all the stories when people "boo" the=
 Atari and are gung ho for the Bally.  It
 tell ya-- it's a conspiracy=
.  (Okay, it might be all in my head!)<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D=
"none">
I'm sure that there must be some Bally Arcade/Astrocade stories out=
 there.  If you're one of those few people who got a Bally Arcade unde=
r the Christmas tree on Christmas Day, then I'd love to hear your story.&nb=
sp; Maybe the Bally was your only system.  Or, perhaps
 you already ha=
d an Atari and you pitted the two systems against each other.  Maybe y=
ou got a Bally Arcade very early (in January 1978) before the Atari VCS was=
 king of America's living rooms.  Or, maybe you got it as a gift while=
 it was on clearance in 1984
 for $25.  Do you have a sad tale to tell=
 that involves asking for an Astrocade, but you got an Atari instead? =
 Were you were up all night crying about what might have been?  Possib=
ly you have a four-player tale of playing 99 rounds of Checkmate against yo=
ur
 parents and little sister on Christmas morning.<br clear=3D"none">
<br =
clear=3D"none">
If your tale is holiday related (Christmas, Hanukkah, or wh=
atever you celebrate), then I'd love to hear it!  Please write in (ema=
il the show) and tell us all about it.  If you're one of those awesome=
 folks who likes to record audio feedback, then that's welcome
 too.<br cle=
ar=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
The next episode of the Astrocast will fea=
ture this holiday feedback in the December (okay, more like mid-January) ep=
isode.<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
I can't wait to hear your tal=
es!<br clear=3D"none">
<br clear=3D"none">
Adam<br clear=3D"none">
